CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Attacked During Daytime Nap - Enjoying a nap in a chair on his back porch (arrow in left photo) last Monday afternoon, 61-year-old Lovett White, right, of 318 Carver St., East Liberty, was brutally beaten and then robbed of about $120, by a thug who apparently hurtled the four-foot-high wooden fence (arrow in left photo).  A vacationing employe [employee] of Pittsburgh Hospital at the time, Mr. White is in that hospital, recovering from what he says are a fractured skull, fractured left forearm and two broken ribs. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Lovett White with bandaged arm and ribs, holding glass of milk, in Pittsburgh Hospital
